Title: Nebraska College & Career Ready Standards > Science > Anatomy & Physiology

Subs.Label: Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the integumentary system.
Plan and conduct and investigation to identify patterns of organization in the integumentary system.
Ask questions to clarify the role of various structures in integumentary system function.
Develop and use a model to identify and describe the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the integumentary system.
Plan and conduct an investigation to gather evidence that feedback mechanisms in the integumentary system help maintain homeostasis.
Engage in arguments from evidence for the role of cell division in integumentary system dysfunction.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the skeletal system.
Plan and conduct an investigation to identify patterns of organization in the skeletal system.
Develop and use a model to identify and describe the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the skeletal system.
Obtain, evaluate, and communicate evidence that feedback mechanisms in the skeletal system help maintain homeostasis.
Develop and use a model to explain the order of events necessary for bone formation.
Engage in arguments from evidence to support claims about the causes of dysfunction in the skeletal system.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the muscular system.
Plan and conduct an investigation to identify patterns of organization in the muscular system.
Develop and use a model to identify and describe the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the muscular system.
Engage in arguments from evidence that muscle contraction is the result of biochemical reactions.
Obtain, evaluate, and communicate evidence that feedback mechanisms in the muscular system help maintain homeostasis.
Engage in arguments from evidence to support claims about the causes of dysfunction in the muscular system.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the nervous system.
Plan and conduct an investigation to identify patterns of organization in the nervous system.
Develop and use a model to identify and describe the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the nervous system.
Engage in arguments from evidence that production of a nerve impulse is the result of biochemical reactions.
Obtain, evaluate, and communicate evidence that feedback mechanisms in the nervous system help maintain homeostasis.
Engage in arguments from evidence to support claims about the causes of dysfunction in the nervous system.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the cardiovascular/respiratory systems.
Plan and conduct an investigation to identify patterns of organization in the cardiovascular/respiratory systems.
Develop and use a model to identify and describe the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the cardiovascular/respiratory systems.
Obtain, evaluate and communicate evidence that feedback mechanisms in the cardiovascular/respiratory systems help maintain homeostasis.
Engage in arguments from evidence to support claims about the causes of dysfunction in the cardiovascular/ respiratory systems.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the digestive system.
Plan and conduct an investigation to identify patterns of organization in the digestive system.
Develop and use a model to identify and describe the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the digestive system.
Obtain, evaluate and communicate evidence that feedback mechanisms in the digestive system help maintain homeostasis.
Engage in arguments from evidence to support claims about the causes of dysfunction in the digestive system.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the urinary system.
Plan and conduct an investigation to identify patterns of organization in the urinary system.
Develop and use a model to identify and describe the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the urinary system.
Obtain, evaluate and communicate evidence that feedback mechanisms in the urinary system help maintain homeostasis.
Engage in arguments from evidence to support claims about the causes of dysfunction in the urinary system.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the reproductive system.
Plan and conduct an investigation to identify patterns of organization in the reproductive system.
Develop and use a model to identify and describe the relationship between the structures and physiological processes of the reproductive system.
Obtain, evaluate and communicate evidence that feedback mechanisms in the reproductive system help maintain homeostasis.
Engage in arguments from evidence to support claims about the causes of dysfunction in the reproductive system.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the connection between health science careers and engineering.
Obtain, evaluate, and communicate information related to health science careers and the various roles they fulfill within the health care system.
Design a solution to a complex, real-world problem affecting body systems that can be solved through engineering.
Evaluate a solution to a complex, real-world human health problem based on prioritized criteria constraints that account for interactions within and between systems.
Gather, analyze, and communicate evidence of the connections between body systems.
Construct and revise an explanation based on evidence for the cycling of matter and flow of energy within and between body systems.
Develop and use models to explain the interactions between body systems.
